sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE ONLY FLARE OF THE PAST DAY WAS A C8/SF AT 02/2352Z IN REGION 7379 (S12W89). THIS IS A SMALL, DECAYING SUNSPOT GROUP NOW AT THE WEST LIMB. sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE LARGEST X-RAY BURST OF THE DAY WAS AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C6 AT 04/0055Z. sections.text: LOW. REGION 7391 MAY INCREASE THE LIKELIHOOD OF M-FLARES.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD EXPERIENCED  MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS FROM 04/0900Z TO 1500Z.

sections.text: GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES. ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE END OF THE THREE DAY FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7386 (S04W92) LET LOOSE WITH A SURPRISE C9/1F FLARE AT 13/0259Z AS IT CROSSED THE WEST LIMB. sections.text: LOW. REGIONS 7400 AND 7399 (N07W38) HAVE THE BEST C-CLASS ACTIVITY POTENTIAL. BOTH ALSO HAVE AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT. REGION 7394 STILL HAS A CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE BEFORE IT ROTATES OFF THE DISK.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH DUE TO A CLASS M9 FLARE THAT WAS REPORTED AS A COMBINATION 3B FLARE AT (N13 E25) IN REGION 7417 (N15 E20) AND A 2B FLARE (N09 E25) IN REGION 7419 (N11 E25).  THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A RADIO BURST OF 660 FLUX UNITS AT 2695 MHZ BUT WITH NO TYPE II/TYPE IV YET REPORTED. THE X-RAY EVENT BEGAN ABOUT 06/1820 UT, THE OPTICAL EVENTS AT 06/1813 UT.  AN EARLIER CLASS M1 FLARE (S09 E56) BEGAN AT 06/1643 UT IN REGION 7420 (S07 E51). AN H-ALPHA FILAMENT BETWEEN 10 AND 15 DEGREES IN HELIOCENTRIC LONGITUDE DISAPPEARED NEAR N00 E15 OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. AT 06/2100, THE GOES X-RAY PLOTS ARE MARKED BY A ATTRACTIVE SERIES OF SINUSOIDAL OSCILLATIONS OF ABOUT 15 MINUTES DURATION EACH AND IN PROGRESS SINCE THE FLUX REACHED NEAR-BACKGROUND LEVELS AROUND 06/1930 UT. THE 10.7 CM FLUX VALUE REPORTED BELOW IS PROBABLY FLARE- ENHANCED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH, WITH CLASS M FLARES LIKELY AND CLASS X FLARES POSSIBLE. THE FOCUS OF ACTIVITY IS IN THE AREA WHERE REGIONS 7417 AND 7419 MEET AND IN POSSIBLE CONNECTIONS TO REGION 7420.  THE NATURE OF THE ACTIVITY IN REGIONS 7417 AND 7419 INDICATES A CHANCE OF AN ENERGETIC PARTICLE EVENT OCCURRING OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET WITH A CHANCE OF ISOLATED UNSETTLED PERIODS.  THE VARIOUS TYPES OF ACTIVITY OCCURRING NEAR SOLAR CENTRAL MERIDIAN MAY BE AN INDICATION OF CHANGES IN THE LARGE SCALE SOLAR MAGNETIC FIELDS WHICH COULD PRODUCE EFFECTS IN THE EARTH'S GEOMAGNETIC FIELD BY 09 FEBRUARY.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7420 (S07W90) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE, AN M5/SF AT 1040Z. THE REGION WAS NEAR THE LIMB AND THIS ALLOWED DETAILED OBSERVATIONS OF LOOP AND SURGE DYNAMICS DURING THE FLARE EVENT. THE OTHER GROUPS ON THE DISK WERE RELATIVELY CALM. REGION 7427 (S21E31) CONTINUES TO SHOW FREQUENT SMALL FLARES. REGION 7425 (N15W01) CONTINUES TO GROW AND PRODUCED A COUPLE OF SMALL FLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR M-CLASS FLARES ARE REGIONS 7420 (FROM BEHIND THE LIMB FOR ONE DAY) AND 7425.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED FOLLOWING A SUDDEN IMPULSE AT 0302Z ON THE 17TH. MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS ENSUED AT MID-LATITUDES AND SEVERE STORM LEVELS WERE ATTAINED AT HIGH LATITUDES BETWEEN 0900-1800Z. CONDITIONS APPEARED TO BE SUBSIDING TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE SOURCE OF THE DISTURBANCE IS UNCERTAIN BUT MAY HAVE RESULTED FROM THE FILAMENT THAT ERUPTED FROM THE DISK LATE ON THE 13TH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE MAY CAUSE SOME NIGHTTIME SUBSTORMS. CONDITIONS SHOULD RETURN TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FIRST DAY. THERE IS A CHANCE FOR AN INCREASE TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY AS A RESPONSE TO TODAY'S MAJOR EVENT. MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS SHOULD DOMINATE BY DAY THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7425 (N16W14) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE DAY WITH AN M4/2B TENFLARE AT 18/0308UT. THIS FLARE HAD ASSOCIATED TYPE II AND TYPE IV RADIO SWEEPS AND A LOOP PROMINENCE ON THE DISK. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED A 1N FLARE WITH A TYPE II SWEEP AT 18/1135 UT, A C1/1F FLARE AT 18/1752UT AND A B8/SF FLARE AT 18/0800UT. REGION 7427 (S19E17) JOINED IN WITH AN M1/1N TENFLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE IV SWEEP AT 18/1003UT, AN M1/1B TENFLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE II SWEEP AT 18/1106UT, A C1/SF FLARE AT 18/1809UT AND A SMALL SF FLARE. REGION 7424 (N10W44) PRODUCED A SMALL C1/SF FLARE AT 18/1335UT AND A SF FLARE AT 18/1254UT. REGIONS 7430 (N08E25), 7431 (S12E55) AND 7432 (S17E73) WERE NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 7425 AND 7427 HAVE THE BEST CHANCE FOR M-CLASS FLARES. REGION 7427 HAS A SMALL CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS SAW A SHORT PERIOD OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FROM 18/1200 TO 1500UT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, THEN ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AS SHOCK FRONTS FROM TODAYS FLARE ACTIVITY REACH THE GEOMAGNETOSPHERE. A GOOD SIZED CORONAL HOLE WILL ROTATE INTO A FAVORABLE POSITION BY THE THIRD DAY OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7435 (N10E26) PRODUCED AN ISOLATED C-CLASS SUBFLARE WHILE DISPLAYING SLIGHT GROWTH. AN ACTIVE SURGE REGION WAS OBSERVED NEAR N13E90 AT 28/1804Z, PROBABLY INDICATING THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7417. NEW REGIONS 7437 (S23W34) AND 7438 (N23E46) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. REGION 7435 MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED C-CLASS SUBFLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 12 NANOTESLA WAS OBSERVED BY THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER AT 27/2220Z. THE IMPULSE WAS FOLLOWED BY MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS. ACTIVITY BEGAN TO SUBSIDE NEAR 28/1800Z. HIGH LATITUDES REACHED ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOLLOWING THE IMPULSE. THIS ACTIVITY MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY EITHER CORONAL HOLE OR DISAPPEARING FILAMENT EFFECTS, OR PERHAPS A COMBINATION THEREOF.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE DURING THE FIRST TWO DAYS DUE TO THE CONTINUING EFFECTS OF FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCES. INTERMITTENT STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE FINAL DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. A PRESENTLY UNCORRE- LATED M1 FLARE OCCURRED AT 02/2053UT. FOR NOW, WE WILL ATTRIBUTE THE FLARE TO NEW REGION 7440 (S05E81), WHICH DISPLAYED ENHANCED PLAGE AND A SURGE AT THE TIME OF THE FLARE. THIS REGION, JUST ROTATING ONTO THE DISK, PROMISES TO BE A WINNER. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED A C5/SF FLARE TODAY AT 02/1510UT. REGION 7435 (N07W00) CONTINUED TO GROW BUT PRODUCED ONLY A C4/1F AT 02/1822UT AND TWO SUB FAINT FLARES. REGION 7433 (N13W57) CONTINUED TO DECAY SLOWLY AND PRODUCED A C1/SF FLARE AT 02/1215UT. FOUR UNCORRELATED C1 FLARES WERE MEASURED AS WELL.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 7435 AND 7440 HAVE THE BEST CLASS C FLARE POTENTIAL. BOTH HAVE POTENTIAL FOR AN ISOLATED CLASS M FLARE ALSO.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS SAW PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS THEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7440 (S07E66) ENDED YESTERDAY WITH AN M5/SF TENFLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE II SWEEP AND LOOP PROMINENCE. THIS LDE REACHED ITS MAXIMUM AT 02/2149UT AND RESULTED IN A MINOR PROTON ENHANCEMENT. THIS REGION APPEARS TO HAVE FULLY ROTATED ONTO THE DISK AND IS NOW CLASSIFIED AS A DKC GROUP. REGION 7435 (N08W15), STILL GROWING, PRODUCED A C3/SF FLARE AS WELL AS MINOR FLARES. THE 32 DEGREE FILAMENT TRAILING REGION 7435 DISAPPEARED YESTERDAY AFTERNOON.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 7435 AND 7440 BOTH HAVE A HIGH C CLASS FLARE POTENTIAL, ISOLATED M CLASS FLARE POTENTIAL AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED X CLASS FLARE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS SAW MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE ACTIVITY CAN BE ATTRIBUTED TO A FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED ON 26 FEBRUARY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7435 (N10W28) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 04/1020UT, A C1/SF AT 03/2314UT, A C6/1N AT 04/0119UT AND A C1/SF AT 04/1519UT. THIS REGION HAS SHOWN SLIGHT DECAY OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. REGION 7440 (S06E53), A SLOWLY GROWING DKC WITH A BETA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION, PRODUCED ONLY TWO SUBFAINT FLARES. REGION 7434 (S11W64), A DECAYING HAX SPOT GROUP, PRODUCED A LONG DURATION C8/2N PROTON FLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE IV SWEEP AT 04/1240UT. A PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10MEV BEGAN AT 04/1505UT AND WAS HOVERING AT EVENT LEVELS AT THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7435 STILL HAS A FAIR CLASS M FLARE POTENTIAL AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED CLASS X FLARE. REGION 7440 HOLDS THE BEST CLASS M FLARE POTENTIAL. THE YOHKOH X-RAY IMAGE SHOWS THIS REGION IS GROWING IN COMPLEXITY AND HOLDS A FAIR CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED CLASS X FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ALL LATITUDES SAW AN ISOLATED MAJOR STORM PERIOD AT 04/0300UT WITH NO APPARENT CAUSE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE FIRST DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ARE EXPECTED THEREAFTER, A RESULT OF THE PAST FEW DAY'S FLARE AND FILAMENT ACTIVITY COUPLED WITH A CORONAL HOLE THAT WILL BE NEARING A FAVORABLE POSITION TOWARDS THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7441 (N08E48), A RAPIDLY GROWING DAO GROUP, PRODUCED THE SECOND LARGEST FLARE OF THE PERIOD, A C4/1F AT 05/0046UT. REGION 7435 (N09W41), SLOWLY DECAYING, PRODUCED THE ONLY OTHER CORRELATED CLASS C FLARE, A C1/SF AT 05/0646UT. THE LARGEST EVENT TODAY WAS AN UNCORRELATED C5 AT 05/1126UT. sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7440 HAS A STRONG POTENTIAL FOR CLASS C FLARES, ISOLATED CLASS M FLARES AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE FOR A CLASS X FLARE. REGIONS 7441 AND 7435 HAVE GOOD CLASS C FLARE POTENTIAL AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED CLASS M FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. YESTERDAY'S PROTON EVENT ENDED AT 04/2000UT WITH A MAXIMUM OF 17 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE LAST TWO DAYS OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AS A RESULT OF FILAMENT AND FLARE ACTIVITY COUPLED WITH A FAVORABLY POSTIONED CORONAL HOLE. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS WILL SEE MAJOR, POSSIBLY SEVERE, STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7440 (S07E27) PRODUCED AN M7/3B TENFLARE WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE II AT 2049Z. THE EVENT IS STILL IN PROGRESS AT THIS WRITING. EARLIER TODAY CLOUDS PREVENTED OBSERVATION OF THE SOURCE OF AN M3 AT 1038Z. THIS FLARE IS LIKELY ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 7440, EASILY THE MOST IMPRESSIVE ON THE DISK. IT SHOWS TWO DELTA CONFIGURATIONS, BOTH IN THE EASTERNMOST TRAILER SPOTS, AS WELL AS A LARGE FIELD OF BRIGHT PLAGE. THE OTHER FIVE SPOTTED REGIONS HAVE BEEN SIMPLE AND MOSTLY QUIET.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7440 SHOULD CONTINUE ITS M-CLASS ACTIVITY OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT PREDOMINANTLY MINOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT 48 HOURS. EFFECTS OF A DISAPPEARING FILAMENT ON 2-3 MARCH AS WELL AS A FAVORABLY-POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE ARE DUE ANY TIME. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL AT THE END OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7440 (S07E14), STILL MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX AND BRIGHT, HAS BEEN OMINOUSLY QUIET SINCE ITS MAJOR FLARE OF A DAY AGO. FINAL REPORTS OF THE TYPE IV ASSOCIATED WITH THE M7/3B FLARE OF 06/2049Z HAD IT LASTING NEARLY 14 HOURS. THE LARGEST EVENT REGION 7440 COULD MUSTER TODAY WAS A C3/0F AT 1309Z. NONETHELESS, THE REGION WARRANTS SERIOUS CONSIDERATION. ELSEWHERE, LITTLE OF SIGNIFICANCE WAS REPORTED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7440 IS LIKELY TO YIELD ANOTHER M-CLASS OR LARGER FLARE IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUXES ATTAINED NEAR-EVENT CRITERIA, FOLLOWING THE M7/3B FLARE AT 06/2049Z. THE FLUXES REGISTERED A SINGLE MAXIMUM OF 11 PFU AT 07/0710Z, AS OPPOSED TO THE REQUIRED THREE CONSECUTIVE 5-MINUTE VALUES OF 10 PFU OR MORE. THE PROTON FLUXES ARE STILL ELEVATED, MEASURING JUST LESS THAN 3 PFU NOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE BRUNT OF THE ACTIVITY SHOULD OCCUR ON 09 MARCH WHEN EFFECTS FROM THE M7/3B FLARE LATE ON 06 MARCH ARE DUE. PERIODS OF MAJOR TO SEVERE STORMING MAY EVENTUATE AT THAT TIME. THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD SLOWLY WEAKEN BY THE END OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7440 (S06W14) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE LITTLE IN THE WAY OF FLARES, WHILE STILL REMAINING LARGE AND MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX. DECAY HAS OCCURRED IN THE LEADER SPOTS OF THE REGION, BUT A DELTA PERSISTS IN THE TRAILER. LITTLE ELSE OF INTEREST WAS REPORTED TODAY, AS BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUXES DROPPED TO WELL BELOW C-LEVEL.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7440, VERY QUIET SINCE ITS MAJOR FLARE LATE ON MARCH 6, MAY PRODUCE ANOTHER IF AN INSTABILITY DEVELOPS WITHIN THE REGION. NONE OF THE REMAINING FOUR SPOTTED REGIONS SEEMS CAPABLE OF ANYTHING BEYOND AN OCCASIONAL SUBFLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT ALL LATITUDES. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 50 NANOTESLA WAS OBSERVED AT BOULDER AT 08/2139Z. CONDITIONS QUICKLY DETERIORATED WITH THE MOST INTENSE DISTURBANCE OCCURRING IN THE 12-15 HOURS AFTER THE PASSAGE OF THE SHOCK. THIS ACTIVITY IS THOUGHT TO BE A RESULT OF THE MAJOR FLARE/CME EVENTS LATE ON MARCH 6.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE THE NEXT 24 HOURS, WITH POSSIBLE EPISODES OF MINOR STORM LEVELS OCCURRING DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES. STRICTLY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL 11-12 MARCH AS THE CURRENT STORM WEAKENS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7440 (S05W27) HAD A FEW C-CLASS FLARES, THE MOST NOTEWORTHY A NEARLY THREE HOUR-LONG C4/1F AT 1227Z. MODEST DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM WERE PART OF THE EVENT. OTHERWISE, THE REGION RETAINS A DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AND IS STILL THE MOST IMPRESSIVE SIGHT ON A DULL DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7440 IS THE BEST HOPE FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY, BUT TO THIS POINT HAS BEEN DISAPPOINTING IN ITS FLARE OUTPUT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS ACTIVE EARLY, THEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED THE MAJORITY OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED THE NEXT THREE DAYS. EFFECTS OF TODAY'S LONG DURATION C4 FLARE MAY BRING EPISODES OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS LATE ON 13 MARCH.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7440 (S05W44) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: AN M1/SF AT 1517Z. THIS GROUP CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE DISK IN SIZE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. THE GROUP PRODUCED ADDITIONAL SMALL FLARES DURING THE DAY AND APPEARS TO BE IN A SLOW DECAY PHASE. REGION 7448 (N16E63) SHOWED GOOD GROWTH DURING THE DAY AND MUSTERED A C9/SF AT 1434Z. A 30 DEGREE FILAMENT DISAPPEARED FROM THE SOUTHEAST PART OF THE DISK SOMETIME BETWEEN 10/2300Z AND 11/0300Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY MODERATE. REGION 7440 IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS AND CONTINUES TO POSSESS SUFFICIENT MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AND STRENGTH TO POSE A FAIR THREAT FOR A MAJOR FLARE OR A PROTON PRODUCING EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED AFTER 0900Z. SINCE THEN MID-LATITUDES HAVE BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AND THE HIGH LATITUDES HAVE WITNESSED MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT TWELVE HOURS OR SO. CONDITIONS SHOULD BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED AFTER THAT UNTIL SOMETIME LATE ON THE 13TH (DAY 2) WHEN EFFECTS FROM YESTERDAY'S LONG DURATION C4 EVENT COULD PERTURB THE FIELD UP TO ACTIVE LEVELS. ACTIVE CONDITIONS WITH SOME HIGH LATITUDE MINOR STORM PERIODS ARE POSSIBLE ON THE THIRD DAY AS EFFECTS CARRY OVER FROM DAY TWO AND AS A RESULT OF POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM TODAY'S DISAPPEARING FILAMENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. TWO MAJOR FLARES OCCURRED DURING THE PERIOD. THE FIRST WAS AN M7/2B FROM REGION 7448 (N16E53) AT 11/2202Z. THE EVENT WAS FAIRLY IMPULSIVE AND AC- COMPANIED BY WEAK RADIO BURSTS AND A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP. THIS GROUP HAS CONTINUED TO SHOW GROWTH AND PRODUCED FREQUENT SMALL FLARES. THE SECOND MAJOR FLARE CAME FROM REGION 7440 (S05W57) AS AN IMPRESSIVE LONG DURATION M7/3N EVENT WHICH STARTED AT 1607Z, PEAKED AT 1815Z, AND REACHED HALF POWER (END) TIME AT 1847Z. THE EVENT WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MODERATE TO STRONG RADIO BURSTS AND MODERATE TYPE II AND TYPE IV SWEEPS. THE REGION CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST ON THE DISK AT 850 MILLIONTHS AND SHOWS MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY IN A DELTA CONFIGURATION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY MODERATE. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS ARE EXPECTED FROM EITHER OF REGION 7440 OR 7448. BOTH REGIONS CONTINUE TO APPEAR IMPRESSIVE AND CONTINUE TO POSE A THREAT FOR ANOTHER  MAJOR FLARE OR PROTON PRODUCING EVENT OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. YESTERDAY'S DISTURBANCE LINGERED ON FROM THE START OF THE PERIOD THROUGH ABOUT 0300Z ON THE 12TH. SINCE THEN THE FIELD HAS BEEN GENERALLY UNSETTLED WITH SOME OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. A 10 PFU GREATER THAN 10MEV PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 12/2010Z IN RESPONSE TO THE M7 FLARE FROM REGION 7440. THE GREATER THAN 100 MEV FLUXES SHOWED A SMALL INCREASE UP TO ABOUT 2 PFU AND WERE TRENDING DOWN AT FORECAST ISSUE TIME. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV FLUXES WERE STILL RISING AT FORECAST ISSUE TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. AN INCREASE IS EXPECTED ON 14-15 MARCH IN RESPONSE TO THE MAJOR FLARE FROM REGION 7440. MID-LATITUDES ARE EXPECTED TO BE AT GENERALLY MINOR STORM LEVELS AND HIGH LATITUDES ARE EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7448 (N16E40) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE, A C5/SF AT 1536Z. THIS GROUP SHOWED MODEST GROWTH OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS AND APPEARS TO HAVE A BETA- GAMMA MAGNETIC CLASS WITH A LONG EAST-WEST INVERSION LINE. THE GROUP PRODUCED ADDITIONAL SMALL FLARES DURING THE DAY. REGION 7440 (S04W69) LOOKS SIMILAR IN STRUCTURE TO YESTERDAY, BUT WAS COMPARITIVELY QUIET AND COULD ONLY MUSTER A COUPLE OF C3 FLARES DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE, WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE OR PROTON PRODUCING EVENT. ACTIVITY LEVELS AND BACKGROUND LEVELS SHOULD DECLINE NOTICABLY WITH THE DEPARTURE OF REGION 7440 FROM THE VISIBLE DISK LATE ON THE 15TH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. SOME ISOLATED PERIODS OF MINOR STORM LEVEL CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 12/2010Z REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 44 PFU AT 13/0155Z AND ENDED AT 13/1245Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS AS A RESPONSE TO YESTERDAY'S LONG DURATION M7 FLARE FROM REGION 7440. CONDITIONS SHOULD SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. ONLY TWO LOW LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED DURING THE PERIOD. REGIONS 7440 (S06W80) AND 7448 (N16E27) PRODUCED ALL OF TODAY'S SCANT ACTIVITY. BOTH GROUPS APPEARED TO BE IN SLOW DECLINE, ALTHOUGH THE LIMB PROX- IMITY OF 7440 MADE MEASUREMENTS DIFFICULT. SOME SMALL, NEW FLUX REGIONS APPEARED TO BE FORMING ON THE DISK TOWARD THE END OF THE DAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT FROM EITHER OF REGION 7440 OR 7448 IS STILL CONSIDERED A POSSIBILITY AS BOTH REGIONS RE- TAIN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AND STRENGTH. A DOWNWARD TREND IN ACTIVITY LEVELS IS EXPECTED DUE TO THE DEPARTURE OF REGION 7440.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. SOME BRIEF MINOR STORM PERIODS OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES. THERE WAS NO COMPELLING EVIDENCE FOR ARRIVAL OF A SHOCK OR AN INCREASE IN GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY LEVELS DUE TO THE LONG DURATION M7 FLARE OF 12 MARCH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS EFFECTS FROM THE 12 MARCH LDE ARE STILL POSSIBLE. A GRADUAL DECLINE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE IS EXPECTED BY DAY TWO AND A RETURN TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS IS EXPECTED BY DAY THREE.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7440 (S06W93) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT, AN M1/2F IN PROGRESS AT 14/2100Z. THE X-RAY SIGNATURE SUGGESTS A GOOD POSSIBILITY FOR PROTONS. A STRONG CALCIUM EMISSION WAS NOTED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7448 MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. A GENERAL UPWARD TREND IN BACK- GROUND LEVELS IS EXPECTED AS AN INFERRED NEW REGION ROTATES AROUND FROM EAST LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. AN INITIALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FIELD CHANGED TO STORM LEVELS FOLLOWING A SUDDEN STORM COMMENCEMENT (SSC) AT 0526UT. MID-LATITUDES EXPERIENCED MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AND HIGH LATITUDES REPORTETD MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE DISTURBANCE WAS BEGINNING TO SUBSIDE NEAR DAY'S END. THIS STORM WAS PROBABLY CAUSED BY THE LONG DURATION M7 FLARE OF 12 MARCH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE OVER THE NEXT 12 HOURS, AFTER WHICH ACTIVITY SHOULD DECLINE UNTIL DAY THREE IN RESPONSE TO THE M-FLARE IN PROGRESS. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS MAY BE ATTAINED ON DAY THREE.

sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7440 PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE SINCE YESTERDAY. NO OPTICAL CLASSIFICATION WAS POSSIBLE, SINCE IT OCCURRED FROM BEYOND THE WEST LIMB, BUT POST FLARE LOOPS WERE OBSERVED AT S02W90. THIS FLARE REACHED AN X-RAY MAXIMUM OF M2 AT 15/2135Z. REGION 7448 (N17W00) IS THE LARGEST REGION PRESENTLY ON THE DISK AND PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES DURING THE PAST DAY. THE LARGEST WAS A C5/SN AT 16/0247Z. NEW REGIONS 7451 (S19E65) AND 7452 (S14E73) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THE LIKELIHOOD OF MAJOR FLARES HAS DECREASED WITH THE DEPARTURE OF REGION 7440.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. THE PACE OF FLARE PRODUCTION HAS PICKED UP CONSIDERABLY. REGION 7448 (N17W47) HAS GENERATED SEVERAL FLARES SINCE YESTERDAY. THE LARGEST WAS AN M1/1N AT 20/0106Z. THIS FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MODERATE TYPE II/IV SWEEPS. MANY OF THE FLARES IN THIS REGION WERE RADIO RICH, WITH DISCRETE BURSTS AND SWEEP ACTIVITY ACROSS THE SPECTRUM. ANOTHER FLARE OF NOTE IN 7448 WAS A C3/SN AT 20/1657Z. THIS FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP. THE REGION HAS SHOWN SOME DECAY OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE SUNSPOT AREA IS REDUCED AND THE DELTA CONFIGURATION IS NO LONGER PRESENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7448 (N18W59) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MAJORITY OF FLARE ACTIVITY. IT PRODUCED AN M2/1N FLARE AT 21/0340Z ASSOCIATED WITH A SIGNIFICANT TYPE IV SPECTRAL RADIO BURST AND A 140 SFU TENFLARE. THIS REGION MAY BE SHOWING SIGNS OF SLOW DECAY IN THE FORM OF OVERALL PENUMBRAL FRAGMENTATION, BUT THIS WAS DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN DUE TO WEST LIMB PROXIMITY. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE REACHING 0.44 SOLAR RADII WAS OBSERVED NEAR N07W90 AT 21/1110Z. NEW REGIONS 7455 (N19W37) AND 7456 (N05E21) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. REGIONS 7448 AND 7452 ARE EXPECTED TO PRODUCE C-CLASS SUBFLARES. REGION 7448 COULD ALSO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET UP TO A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 11 NANOTESLA (AT BOULDER) AT 1434Z. THE FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT ALL LATITUDES SINCE. THE GOES SPACECRAFT HAVE EXPERIENCED MULTIPLE MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS DURING THIS DISTURBANCE, THE MOST LENGTHY ABOUT TWO HOURS, ENDING AT 1800Z. THE EQUATORWARD LOBE OF THE SOUTHERN POLAR CROWN CORONAL HOLE, NOW POSITIONED NEAR S30W25, IS THOUGHT TO BE THE SOURCE OF THE HIGH SPEED STREAM NOW BUFFETING THE MAGNETOSPHERE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS THE NEXT 24-48 HOURS. THE POSSIBILITY OF EPISODES OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES IS GOOD. THIS DISTURBANCE SHOULD ABATE BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT WAS A C4 AT 1648Z (THE ONLY C-CLASS EVENT OF THE DAY) WHICH WAS CORRELATED WITH SOME ACTIVITY ON EAST LIMB AT ABOUT N23. THERE APPEARS TO BE A NEW REGION ROTATING INTO VIEW AT THAT LOCATION. THE REMAINDER OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY WAS VERY LIMITED. ALL OF THE REGIONS ON THE DISK WERE BASICALLY STABLE AND QUIET. REGION 7469 (S10E15) SHOWED SOME GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT OF A MAGNETIC GAMMA CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILING SPOTS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR C-FLARES ARE REGION 7469 AND THE NEW REGION ON EAST LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. YESTERDAY'S STORM DEVELOPED INTO A MAJOR STORM AT MID-LAT- ITUDES AND MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES. A BRIEF 3 HOUR PERIOD OF SEVERE STORM WAS OBSERVED AT MID-LATITUDES FROM 0300-0600Z. THIS DISTURBANCE MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE, BUT ITS MORPHOLOGY AND SEVERITY RAISE DOUBTS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS AS NIGHTTIME SUBSTORMS ARE LIKELY. CONDITIONS SHOULD SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AS THE DISTURBANCE ENDS.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7465 (S06W52) ERUPTED WITH A LONG DURATION C5/1F FLARE AT 08/0306Z. A FORTY MINUTE TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP ACCOMPANIED THIS FLARE. REGION 7470 (S06W21) DEVELOPED OVERNIGHT WITH TEN NEW SPOTS. ADJACENT REGION 7469 (S11W25) ALSO SHOWS TEN NEW SPOTS. REGION 7469 PRODUCED A LONG DURATION C6/1N AT 08/2000Z. sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7565 IS DECLINING WHILE REGIONS 7469 AND 7470 APPEAR TO BE MERGING. THESE REGIONS ALL HAVE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE A MAJOR FLARE. THEY ARE ALSO IN PRIME LOCATION FOR A PROTON EVENT.

sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. SEVERAL SMALL FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PAST DAY. MANY OF THEM OCCURRED ALONG THE EAST-WEST INVERSION LINE SEPARATING REGIONS 7470 (S07W48) AND 7469 (S11W52). TODAY'S F10.7 READING FROM PENTICTON IS NOT AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME AND IS ESTIMATED BELOW FROM A 2695 MHZ LOCAL-NOON DRIFT READING AT SAGAMORE HILL.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  THE MOST SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY HAS BEEN A SERIES OF CLASS C FLARES.  MOST OF THEM HAVE BEEN IN REGION 7500 (N17E39) WITH OCCASIONAL SMALLER FLARES IN REGION 7496 (N15E22) AS WELL. REGION 7500 CONTINUES TO BE THE MAIN AREA OF INTEREST.  A SMALL FILAMENT HAS DISAPPEARED NEAR THE CENTER OF THE DISK, NEAR THE NEWER REGIONS 7501 (S10W03) AND 7499 (S08W11), SIGNALLING SOME POSSIBLE LARGE SCALE REARRANGEMENT OF MAGNETIC STRUCTURES IN THAT AREA.  A NEGATIVE POLARITY CORONAL HOLE WITH CONSISTENT DEFINITION AND SIZE IS NOW LOCATED AROUND NO5 TO S20 AND W20 TO W40.

sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7515 (N14E51) PRODUCED AN M1/2B FLARE AT 1755Z. THIS GROUP PRODUCED NUMEROUS ADDITIONAL C-CLASS FLARES AND IS THE DOMINANT REGION ON THE SOLAR DISK. THE SPOTS ARE ARRANGED IN A COMPLICATED BETA-GAMMA STRUCTURE WHICH IS ABUTTED TO THE TRAILING PART OF 7514 (N17E43). REGION 7512 (N08E23) EXHIBITED SLOW STEADY GROWTH DURING THE DAY BUT ONLY PRODUCED A COUPLE OF SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ADDITIONAL, ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7515.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS WITH MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED EARLY ON THE 27TH. MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS WITH MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDE PREVAILED THROUGH THE NIGHTTIME HOURS, BUT ACTIVITY WAS RUNNING QUIET TO UNSETTLED NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. SOME PERSISTENT EFFECTS FROM TODAY'S DISTURBANCE ARE EXPECTED TO LINGER OVER THE NEXT 12 HOURS. EFFECTS FROM A 28 DEGREE FILA- MENT THAT DISAPPEARED ON THE 24TH MAY LEAD TO A CONTINUATION OF ACTIVE LEVELS THROUGH DAY TWO. THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD SHOULD RETURN TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS BY DAY THREE.

sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. REGIONS 7515 AND 7518 ARE EXPECTED TO PRODUCE C-CLASS SUBFLARES. REGION 7515 ALSO PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. STORM CONDITIONS BEGAN NEAR 04/0700Z AND MAY HAVE BEEN DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. SOME HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS REPORTED SEVERE STORM LEVELS NEAR 04/1200Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST TWO DAYS DUE TO CONTINUING CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. BRIEF MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM PERIODS COULD OCCUR AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE FINAL DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7518 (S09W35) ERUPTED WITH AN M5/2B FLARE AT 07/1425Z. AN 1100 SFU TENFLARE, MAJOR TYPES II AND IV SPECTRAL RADIO SWEEP BURSTS, AND A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM ACCOMPANIED THE FLARE. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES BEFORE AND FOLLOWING THE MAJOR FLARE. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7518 MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES. THERE IS ALSO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR ANOTHER MAJOR FLARE FROM THIS REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. BRIEF PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING WERE REPORTED BY SOME HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS. A GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT FOLLOWED THE M5/2B FLARE. IT BEGAN AT 07/1510 AND REACHED A MAXIMUM FLUX OF 6.2 PFU AT 07/1835Z. THE ENHANCEMENT WAS IN PROGRESS AND GRADUALLY DECLINING AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS UNTIL LATE 09 JUNE - EARLY 10 JUNE WHEN THE EFFECTS OF THE M5/2B ARE EXPECTED TO ARRIVE. THEREAFTER, THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE PROTON ENHANCEMENT IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO PREFLARE LEVELS DURING THE FIRST DAY OF THE PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. NEW REGION 7524 (N10E64) PRODUCED C1/SF FLARES AT 19/0015Z AND 19/11332Z. THE EARLIER EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A WEAK TYPE II BURST. REGION 7524 IS A SMALL SPOT GROUP WITH WEAK TO MODERATE PEAK X-RAY EMISSION (AS VISIBLE IN YOHKOH IMAGERY). ANOTHER TYPE II WITH A VERY WEAK LONG DURATION GOES X-RAY ENHANCEMENT OCCURRED AT 19/1903Z. NO SIGNIFICANT DISK ENHANCEMENT WAS OBSERVED WITH THIS RADIO EVENT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A LOW LEVEL. INTERMITTENT LOW LEVEL CLASS C FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM NEW REGION 7524. THERE ARE FAINT INDICATIONS ON THE YOHKOH DATA OF NEW REGIONS BEYOND THE NORTHEAST LIMB AND THE TYPE II AT 1903Z MAY HAVE BEEN FROM A FLARE BEYOND THE LIMB. DUE TO THIS UNCERTAINTY, A MODERATE LEVEL FLARE MUST BE CONSIDERED A POSSIBILITY FROM THIS AS YET UNSEEN AREA.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7524 (N10E51) PRODUCED A C5/1N AT 19/2348Z WITH A MODERATE INTENSITY TYPE II. THIS REGION IS NOW WITHOUT VISIBLE SPOTS. A VERY LONG DURATION B9 X-RAY ENHANCEMENT OCCURRED BETWEEN 20/1455-1941Z. A LONG LIVED TYPE IV ACCOMPANIED THIS EVENT. NO DISK REGIONS WERE RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS ENHANCEMENT. HOWEVER, SURGING WAS VISIBLE AT NE14 COINCIDENT IN TIME. NO X-RAY IMAGERY WAS AVAILABLE TO VERIFY THE CORRELATION. REGION 7525 (S17W22) EMERGED RAPIDLY AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES. REGION 7526 (N13W24) EMERGED AT A LESSER RATE AND WAS VOID OF BURST ACTIVITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A LOW LEVEL WITH C-CLASS FLARES BECOMING MORE FREQUENT. NEW REGION 7525 SHOULD PRODUCE MOST OF THESE EVENTS SHOULD GROWTH CONTINUE. THE LONG DURATION B9 ENHANCEMENT WITH TYPE IV WAS POSSIBLY FROM A LARGER FLARE BEYOND THE LIMB. IT REMAINS POSSIBLE THAT AN M-CLASS FLARE COULD ORIGINATE FROM A REGION JUST BEYOND THE EAST LIMB.

sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. YOHKOH IMAGES FROM 20-21 JUN INDICATE THE VERY LONG DURATION B9 EVENT MENTIONED ON 20 JUN WAS INDEED FROM THE EAST LIMB. BROAD ENHANCEMENTS WERE VISIBLE NEAR NE16 AND SE10 WITH EXTENSIVE LOOP SYSTEMS. THE SOUTHERN AREA WAS THE MOST INTENSE.  CURRENT DISK REGIONS WERE PREDOMINANTLY QUIET. REGION 7525 (S22W33) GREW TO A SMALL CLASS D GROUP BUT THE RATE OF EMERGENCE SLOWED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BECOME
sections.text: LOW. OLD REGION 7518 IS DUE BACK AT THE SOUTHEAST LIMB ON 24-25 JUN. IF IN FACT THE LONG DURATION B9 FLARE WAS FROM THAT REGION, THE FLARE COULD WELL HAVE BEEN QUITE HIGH IN PEAK FLUX. IT IS REASONABLE THAT AN X FLARE 4 DAYS BEHIND THE LIMB COULD RESULT IN THE SIGNATURE SEEN ON 20 JUN. AN M-CLASS FLARE REMAINS A POSSIBILITY UNTIL THE REGION COMES INTO FULL VIEW ALLOWING AN ACCURATE ASSESSMENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR 22 JUN. A CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN IN THE LATTER HALF OF 23 JUN AND CONTINUE THROUGH 24 JUN.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. ONLY ONE C-CLASS FLARE WAS PRODUCED TODAY: A C1/SF AT 1329Z FROM REGION 7525 (S17W48). THE GROUP SHOWED MODEST GROWTH AND WAS THE ONLY REGION ON THE DISK PRODUCING ACTIVITY. NEVERTHELESS THE REGION REMAINS SMALL (90 MILLIONTHS) AND MAGNETICALLY SIMPLE. SURGE ACTIVITY WAS REPORT- ED ON EAST LIMB AT ABOUT S10.

sections.text: LOW. AN UPWARD TREND IN ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS IS ANTI- CIPATED WITH THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7518 (S10, L=017) ON 25 JUNE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 12-24 HOURS. AN INCREASE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN SOMETIME LATE ON THE 23RD DUE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. ACTIVE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO PREDOMINATE THROUGH DAY TWO AND SHOULD SUBSIDE SOMETIME EARLY ON DAY THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S ONLY C-CLASS EVENT WAS A C1 LONG DURATION EVENT WHICH PEAKED AROUND 23/2100Z. THERE WAS NO OPTICAL SIGNATURE FOR THIS EVENT, SUGGESTING A SOURCE BE- HIND THE SOLAR LIMB. INTERESTINGLY, THE X-RAY EVENT WAS JUST PRECEDED BY A BRIGHT SURGE EVENT ON THE LIMB (BSL) AT S18E90 SHOWING SPIKES AS HIGH AS .18 SOLAR RADII IN H-ALPHA. AN EPL WAS REPORTED FROM CORONAL OBSERVATIONS IN GOOD TIME CORRESPONDENCE TO THE BSL. AN ADDITIONAL LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT (ALSO LACK- ING AN OPTICAL SIGNATURE) WAS OBSERVED AROUND 0900Z. REGION 7525 (S18W61) UNDERWENT CONSIDERABLE DECAY TODAY. REGION 7528 (N02E07) SHOWED GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT OF MATURE SPOTS AND THE FORMATION OF A BETA-GAMMA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. NEW REGION 7529 (S12E67) ROTATED INTO VIEW.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. A GRADUAL INCREASE IN ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS IS ANTICIPATED ON DAY TWO WITH THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7518 (S10, L=017).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. A NOTABLE INCREASE IN ACTIVITY FROM VERY QUIET LEVELS TO UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE LEVELS OCCURRED JUST AFTER 22/2100Z. CONDITIONS DIMINISHED A BIT FROM 0600-1800Z BUT APPEARED TO BE PICKING UP AGAIN TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS DUE TO CO- RONAL HOLE EFFECTS. CONDITIONS SHOULD DIMINISH TO MOSTLY UN- SETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 7529 (S13E53) PRODUCED AN M9/2B FLARE AT 0735Z, WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS OF IMPORTANCE 3, AND A 2695 MHZ RADIO BURST OF 450 FLUX UNITS. REGION 7528 (N03W07) HAS GROWN RAPIDLY, MORE THAN DOUBLING ITS SIZE OVERNIGHT. SURGING AT THE EAST LIMB CONTINUED AT ABOUT S08. AN M4/1F FLARE OCCURRED AT 1727 AT S12E90, WITH A 2695 MHZ BURST OF 130 FLUX UNITS, FOLLOWED BY AN M1 AT 1818Z WITH ANOTHER 2695 BURST OF 150 UNITS, PROBABLY ORIGINATING FROM THE SAME AREA. THIS REGION IS NOT YET VISIBLE FOR SUNSPOT CLASSIFICATION, SO A REGION NUMBER HAS NOT BEEN ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 7529 HAS THE HIGHEST PROBABLILITY OF THE NUMBERED REGIONS OF PRODUCING M-FLARES, WITH A FAIR CHANCE OF PRODUCING AN X-FLARE. THE AS YET UNUMBERED REGION APPEARS TO BE QUITE ACTIVE ALREADY, AND MAY BE OLD REGION 7518, WHICH PRODUCED THREE M-FLARES ON ITS LAST PASSAGE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, WITH SHORT PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING AT MID-LATITUDES AND MAJOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES. THIS ACTIVITY IS MOST LIKELY DUE TO THE CORONAL HOLE IN THE WESTERN SOLAR HEMISPHERE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE UNTIL MIDDAY TOMORROW DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. ENHANCED ACTIVITY DUE TO THE M9 FLARE IS EXPECTED TO START BY LATE IN THE DAY TOMORROW AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE SECOND DAY. THE THIRD DAY OF THE PERIOD SHOULD BE BACK TO UNSETTLED LEVELS.

IT IS THE CAUSE OF THE UNCORRELATED LIMB EVENTS OF THE LAST FORTY-EIGHT HOURS. MANY LOOPS AND SURGES HAVE ACCOMPANIED ITS LIMB PASSAGE. REGION 7529 (S43E37) SHOWS STRONG MAGNETIC GRADIENTS BUT IT HAS NOT FLARED.

sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7530 (S11E56) PRODUCED TWO M FLARES, AN M1/1N AT 0145Z AND AN M1/SN AT 1507Z, AS WELL AS SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES. THIS REGION SHOWED FREQUENT PLAGE FLUCTUATIONS MOST OF THE DAY AND SEVERAL OF THE FLARES HAD MULTIPLE CENTERS. REGION 7529 (S12E27) HAS BEEN RELATIVELY STABLE BUT RETAINS A STRONG MAGNETIC GRADIENT. IF IT HAS REACHED ITS MAXIMUM SIZE, WE SHOULD SEE MORE FLARES FROM IT DURING ITS DECAY PHASE. IT PRODUCED ONE C2/SF FLARE THIS PERIOD. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED: REGION 7531 AT N01W17 AND REGION 7532 AT N09W23.

THE REGION CONTINUES TO GROW AND REMAINS MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX. REGION 7528 (N01W60) BECAME ACTIVE AGAIN AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SF FLARES. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED. sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS VARIED BETWEEN QUIET AND STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE PERIOD BEGAN WITH UNSETTLED CONDITIONS BUT INCREASED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AFTER 0000Z, LASTING THROUGH 1200Z. INTERVALS AT MAJOR STORM LEVELS WERE REPORTED AT HIGH LATITUDES. ACTIVITY HAS DECLINED IN RECENT HOURS TOWARD UNSETTLED TO QUIET CONDITIONS. THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS UNKNOWN.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED AT A VERY LOW LEVEL. A SMALL REGION EMERGED ON THE DISK AND WAS NUMBERED AS 7579 (N09W47). RECENT YOHKOH IMAGES VERIFIED THE EXISTENCE OF A LARGE CORONAL HOLE EXTENDING FROM NEAR THE SOUTHEAST LIMB TO CENTRAL MERIDIAN NEAR N15. THIS HOLE INCREASED IN EAST-WEST EXTENT DURING THE PAST 27 DAYS. IT HAS ALSO NEARLY CONNECTED TO A LOBE OF THE NORTHERN POLAR HOLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT VERY LOW LEVELS FOR THE DURATION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: FORECAST TO BE UNSETTLED FOR 09 SEP. A CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON 10 SEP. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED ON 11 SEP. THE CONFIDENCE IN THIS FORECAST IS HIGH DUE TO THE LARGE LATITUDINAL EXTENT OF THE HOLE(S) EXPECTED TO PRODUCE THE DISTURBANCE AND THE STRONG 27 DAY RECURRENCE OF ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS FROM THESE SOLAR LONGITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7585 (S07W02) CONTINUED ITS DRAMATIC GROWTH, NOW MEASURING 200 MILLIONTHS IN WHITE LIGHT AREA AND NUMBERING 20 SPOTS. THE MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION REMAINS ESSENTIALLY BIPOLAR, AS EVIDENCED BY ITS ABILITY TO PRODUCE JUST SMALL FLARES TO THIS POINT. THE LARGEST OFFERING TODAY WAS A C1/0F AT 0517Z. THIS IS THE SOLE SPOTTED REGION ON AN OTHERWISE DULL DISK. TODAY'S 10.7 CM FLUX IS THE LOWEST IN YEARS.

sections.text: LOW, PENDING FURTHER DEVELOPMENT IN REGION 7585.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO MILDLY ACTIVE EARLY ON, THEN RELAX TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE END OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. HOWEVER, STRONG SURGING NEAR N13E90 AND A LONG-DURATION C2 TENFLARE WITH TYPES II AND IV SWEEP AT 0237Z HERALDED THE ARRIVAL OF A NEW ACTIVE REGION TO THE VISIBLE DISK. PRELIMINARY REPORTS INDICATE THERE MAY BE A MATURE H-TYPE SPOT COMING INTO VIEW FOR THIS AS YET UNNUMBERED REGION. A JUMP IN TODAY'S 10.7 CM FLUX, AS WELL AS FREQUENT TYPE III SWEEP AND A 245 MHZ RADIO NOISE STORM, ALL LEND SUPPORT TO THE POTENTIAL VOLATILITY OF THIS NEW SPOT GROUP. ELSEWHERE, REGION 7585 (S07W28) CONTINUED TO GROW WHILE PRODUCING OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES.

sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7590 (N12E63) PRODUCED THE PERIOD'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/SN AT 27/2249Z. THE REGION HAS ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW AS AN IMPRESSIVE FKI SPOT GROUP WITH AN AREA OF ABOUT 1100 MILLIONTHS. THERE IS SOME EVIDENCE OF A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILING SEC- TION OF THE LARGE LEADER SPOT COMPLEX. REGION 7585 (N07W56) SHOWED STEADY DECAY DURING THE PERIOD. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7590 (N12E50) PRO- DUCED ONLY A FEW LOW-LEVEL C-CLASS EVENTS IN SPITE OF ITS IM- PRESSIVE SIZE (1140 MILLIONTHS) AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY (BETA- GAMMA-DELTA). THE DELTA IN THE LEADER DECAYED AS THE MAGNETIC INVERSION LINE JUST EAST OF THE LARGE LEADER SPOT APPEARED TO RELAX. THERE IS A WEAK DELTA IN THE TRAILER SPOTS AND THIS PART OF THE GROUP WAS MOST ACTIVE DURING THE PERIOD. FREQUENT TYPE III RADIO SWEEPS WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD. THE REMAINING GROUPS ON THE DISK WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE BECAUSE OF THE CONTINUED FLARE POTENTIAL IN REGION 7590.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO ACTIVE. THE ACTIVE CONDITIONS BEGAN AFTER 0600Z AND CONTINUED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. SOME ISOLATED MINOR TO MAJOR STORM PERIODS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE INCREASE APPEARS TO BE A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S ACTIVITY WAS CHAR- ACTERIZED BY OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES. ALL OF THESE WERE FROM REGION 7590 (N12E36). DESPITE THE LOW LEVEL OF FLARE ACTIVITY THE REGION CONTINUES TO BE IMPRESSIVE LOOKING: GROWTH AND IN- CREASE OF INTENSITY OF PLAGE WERE NOTED. THE GROUP STILL SHOWS A DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILER AREA. THE 245-610 MHZ SOLAR RADIO EMISSION BANDS WERE NOISY AND DISPLAYED FREQUENT BURST ACTIVITY. A SMALL H-TYPE GROUP ROTATED AROUND EAST LIMB AT S10 AND WAS ASSIGNED 7592 (S10E79). THE REMAINING REGIONS ON THE DISK WERE STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE CONTINUED GROWTH OF REGION 7590 SUGGESTS IN- CREASED PROBABILITY FOR AN M-CLASS LEVEL EVENT. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FROM THE BEG- INNING OF THE PERIOD THROUGH ABOUT 1200Z. SINCE THEN CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN GENERALLY QUIET.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE TOMORROW BECOMING MOSTLY ACTIVE ON DAY TWO. THE PREDICTION FOR ACTIVITY ABOVE BACK- GROUND IS BASED ON RECURRENCE PATTERNS. CONDITIONS SHOULD BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED BY DAY THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. MOST OF TODAY'S C-LEVEL FLARE ACTIVITY CAME FROM REGION 7590 (N13E22) INCLUDING A C1/SF AT 30/2244Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A MODERATE TYPE II SWEEP. THERE WAS SOME EVIDENCE OF DECAY IN THE TRAILER PART OF THE GROUP AND THE DELTA APPEARED TO BE NEARLY GONE BY DAY'S END: THE PLAGE HAS COOLED OFF IN THIS PART OF THE GROUP. ON THE OTHER HAND SOME NEW POSITIVE POLARITY SPOTS BEGAN TO EMERGE IN A CIR- CULAR ARC IN FRONT OF AND ABOVE THE LARGE NEGATIVE POLARITY LEADER OF THE GROUP. SHEAR ANALYSIS SHOWS SOME SIGNIFICANT MAG- NETIC SHEAR JUST TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE LEADER. REGION 7592 (S13E66) HAS ROTATED MORE CLEARLY INTO VIEW AS A BRIGHT (BUT SMALL) C-TYPE GROUP WHICH ALSO CONTRIBUTED A COUPLE OF C-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. A WEAK TYPE II SWEEP WAS REPORTED TO HAVE OCCURRED AT 01/2034Z AND MAY HAVE BEEN RELATED TO A SUB- FLARE OUT OF REGION 7590 WHICH WAS IN PROGRESS AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7590 STILL SHOWS GOOD POTENTIAL FOR PRODUCING MODERATE SIZED FLARES. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A MAJOR FLARE AS WELL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD THROUGH ABOUT 1500Z, WITH SOME REPORTS OF ISOLATED MAJOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES. CON- DITIONS HAVE CALMED DOWN TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED SINCE THEN. THE DISTURBANCE FITS IN WITH A RECURRENCE PATTERN IN THE GEOMAGNETIC RECORD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS AS A RESULT OF LOCAL MIDNIGHT SUBSTORM ACTIVITY. CONDITIONS SHOULD RETURN TO PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED THEREAFTER AND FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

MAGNETIC GRADIENTS IN REGION 7592 INCREASED. A TENUOUS FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR S31W31 FADED BETWEEN 05/1000-1401Z. RECENT YOHKOH IMAGERY SHOWS A MODERATELY LARGE CORONAL HOLE NEAR CENTRAL MERIDIAN THAT EXTENDS FROM THE NORTH POLE TO SLIGHTLY PAST THE EQUATOR. THIS HOLE IS WIDER (MOSTLY TO THE EAST) AND LESS SINUOUS THAN LAST ROTATION.

sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY LOW. REGIONS 7590 AND 7592 ARE CAPABLE OF ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES. A MAJOR FLARE FROM EITHER REGION REMAINS A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY.

sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. A CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON 09 OCT. DUE TO THE EVOLUTION OF THE HOLE MENTIONED ABOVE, THE DISTURBANCE THIS ROTATION SHOULD BE AS SEVERE AS LAST ROTATION, PEAK ABOUT ONE DAY LATER, AND LAST APPROXIMATELY ONE DAY LONGER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7590 (N10W85) PRODUCED AN M1/SF FLARE AT 09/0811Z AND AN M3/3B FLARE AT 09/1915Z. WEAK DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS ACCOMPANIED BOTH FLARES. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WERE NOTED IN THE REGION PRIOR TO THESE FLARES. REGION 7592 (S16W41) ALSO SHOWED NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGE AND PRODUCED TWO C-CLASS SUBFLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. REGION 7590 POSES A SLIGHT BUT DIMINISHING THREAT FOR ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARING AS IT CROSSES THE LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGHER LATITUDES RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE BULK OF STORM ACTIVITY OCCURRED BETWEEN 09/0500-1300Z AND WAS PROBABLY DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST DAY WITH BRIEF PERIODS OF MAJOR TO SEVERE STORMING POSSIBLE, ESPECIALLY AT HIGH LATITUDES. ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS DURING THE SECOND DAY AS CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS SUBSIDE. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. NEW REGION 7607 (S04E22) EMERGED ON THE DISK AS A SIMPLE BIPOLAR GROUP. X-RAY IMAGES INDICATE A BRIGHTENING ON THE NORTH EAST LIMB WHICH MAY BE THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7590, A PRODUCER OF M-CLASS FLARES LAST ROTATION. A FILAMENT ASSOCIATED WITH UNSPOTTED ACTIVE REGION 7600 (N14W73) DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 21/1449 AND 22/1547.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW BASED ON THE ATTRIBUTES OF REGIONS PRESENTLY VISIBLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HOWEVER, ISOLATED PERIODS AT ACTIVE LEVELS WERE REPORTED AT SOME OBSERVATORIES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT UNSETTLED TO OCCASIONALLY ACTIVE LEVELS INCREASING TOWARD GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD BASED ON A CORONAL DISTURBANCE SEEN IN X-RAY IMAGES ON 21 OCT.  THE DISTURBANCE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE NEAR S14W08.

sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. REGION 7604 (N09W45) HAS GROWN AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES. sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT UNSETTLED LEVELS TOMORROW, INCREASING TOWARD GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS IN RESPONSE TO POSSIBLE DISTURBED SOLAR WIND FROM A CORONAL EVENT NEAR CENTER SOLAR DISK ON 21 OCTOBER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SINGLE C-CLASS X-RAY EVENT OCCURRED AT 0503Z BUT NO OPTICAL EVENT WAS REPORTED.  NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.  OLD REGION 7590 HAS RETURNED AS WEAK, SPOTLESS PLAGE. A MAJOR FILAMENT (29 DEGREES LONG CENTERED NEAR N25W68) BEGAN LIFTING AT ABOUT 1245Z AND EVOLVED INTO AN EPL EXTENDING OUT TO .33 SOLAR RADIUS NEAR N22W90. THE ERUPTION ENDED BY 1422Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW. ONLY ISOLATED C-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS ARE LIKELY FROM REGIONS PRESENTLY OBSERVED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY QUIET FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS OCCURRED EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT THAT ACTIVITY CEASED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE BASED ON THE ARRIVAL OF DISTURBED SOLAR WIND ORIGINATING WITH A FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE AND CORONAL X-RAY EVENT NEAR CENTER SOLAR DISK ON 21 OCTOBER. UNSETTLED TO OCCASIONALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD THEN PREVAIL FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. TODAY'S EPL IS NOT EXPECTED TO IMPACT EARTH.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. NEW REGION 7608 (N09E53) EMERGED ON THE DISK AS A SMALL BUT HOT BXO GROUP AND PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY C-CLASS FLARE: A C6/SF AT 2004Z. REGIONS 7604 (N08W74) AND 7605 (S16W61) BOTH SHOWED DECAY. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED SHORTLY AFTER 0600Z. MID-LATITUDES WERE PREDOMINANTLY AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT ACTIVE TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE PEAK OF THE ACTIVITY APPEARED TO BE FROM ABOUT 1330-1700Z DURING WHICH TIME MID-LATITUDES ATTAINED MAJOR STORM LEVELS AND HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE MOST PROBABLE SOURCE FOR THE DISTURBANCE WAS A FILAMENT ERUPTION WITH AN ASSOCIATED X-RAY EVENT THAT OCCURRED ON 21 OCTOBER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE PROVIDES A HIGH PROBABILITY FOR NIGHTTIME SUBSTORMS. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE UN- SETTLED TO ACTIVE ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS DUE TO EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7608 (N10E40) PRO- DUCED ALL OF TODAY'S OBSERVED FLARE ACTIVITY INCLUDING THE LARGEST EVENT: A C5/1F AT 0044Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A TYPE II RADIO SWEEP. THE REGION REMAINS SMALL AND UNIMPRESSIVE IN WHITE LIGHT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD THROUGH ABOUT 1600Z. SINCE THEN THE MID-LATITUDES ATTAINED ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AND HIGH LATITUDES SAW SOME MINOR STORM PERIODS. A CORONAL HOLE APPEARS TO BE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR THIS INCREASE IN ACTIVITY. A FOOTNOTE TO YESTERDAY'S DISTURBANCE - MAGNETO- PAUSE CROSSINGS WERE OBSERVED AT GOES-6 DURING THE PEAK OF THE ACTIVITY FROM 25/1330Z TO 25/1700Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT ACTIVE LEVELS WITH MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. CONDITIONS SHOULD BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS ALTHOUGH THERE IS A CHANCE FOR SOME HIGH LATITUDE MINOR STORM- ING.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED LOW. REGION 7608 (N09E29) PRODUCED A C9/SN AT 0640Z WITH A MINOR 10 CM BURST AND A MODERATE IMPORTANCE TYPE II WITH A SHOCK SPEED OF 1000 KM/S. REGION 7608 IS A BROAD BIPOLE WITH AN ISOLATED POLE OF TRAILER POLARITY IN THE LEADER FIELDS. SUNSPOT AREA HERE IS SMALL AT ABOUT 30 MILLIONTHS. A SMALL REGION EMERGED AT S10W42 AND WAS NUMBERED AS REGION 7610. OLD REGION 7592 FAILED TO SURVIVE THE INVISIBLE HEMISPHERE TRANSIT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A LOW LEVEL FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. REGION 7608 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES. AN M-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION IS A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. SEVERE STORM LEVELS WERE REACHED AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES DURING PRE-DAWN PERIODS. THE SEVERITY OF THIS DISTURBANCE WAS UNEXPECTED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ON 28 OCT. MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ARE FORECAST FOR 29 OCT AND UNSETTLED CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED ON 30 OCT. THIS FORECAST IS BASED UPON THE EQUATORWARD EXTENSION OF THE NORTHERN POLAR HOLE WHOSE HIGH SPEED STREAM SHOULD SWEEP BEYOND THE EARTH ON 29 OCT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7608 (N10E16) PRODUCED A C1 AT 0924Z. A VERY LONG DURATION B4 X-RAY ENHANCEMENT OCCURRED BETWEEN APPROXIMATELY 0212-1110Z. A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM WAS OBSERVED AT S11E90 SLIGHTLY AFTER THE ENHANCEMENT AND IS THE LIKELY OPTICAL COUNTERPART. A YOHKOH IMAGE AT 0830Z ALSO SHOWED ENHANCED LIMB EMISSION AT THAT TIME. THIS SAME IMAGE ALSO ILLUSTRATED THE SOURCE LOCATION OF A C1 X-RAY BURST AS BEING FROM A PLAGE NEAR S17E70.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: LOW WITH REGION 7608 PRODUCING OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES. THE LONG DURATION EVENT FROM BEYOND THE EAST LIMB DOES NOT INDICATE A SIGNIFICANT REGION IS DUE TO APPEAR. THE EVENT WAS MORE LIKELY FROM AN ERUPTING FILAMENT AS OPPOSED TO A LARGE FLARE SEVERAL DAYS BEHIND THE LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS NEAR 1200Z.  THIS DISTURBANCE IS MOST LIKELY FROM A HIGH SPEED STREAM ORIGINATING FROM A HOLE NOW IN THE FAR NORTHWEST QUADRANT. A SMALL FORBUSH DECREASE WAS OBSERVED BETWEEN 25-27 OCT INDICATING THAT STORM CONDITIONS ON THOSE DAYS WERE A RESULT OF A DENSE STREAM WHICH ORIGINATED FROM NEAR CENTRAL MERIDIAN ON THE SUN ON 21 OCT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED ON 29 OCT EXCEPT DURING LOCAL MIDNIGHT PERIODS WHEN ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED. MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE FORECAST FOR 30-31 OCT.

sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TWO C1-CLASS BURSTS WERE OBSERVED. REGION 7613 (S12E67) SHOWED ITSELF AS A MODERATE SIZE CLASS D GROUP WHICH IS NEW FROM LAST ROTATION. DUE TO SPOT ORIENTATION, IT APPEARS TO BE BIPOLAR. REGION 7608 (N11W11) GREW SLIGHTLY IN WHITE LIGHT. A DENSE 10 DEGREE LONG FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR S15E35 FADED BETWEEN 29/1151-2245Z. THE CORONAL HOLE THAT CAUSED THE GEOMAGNETIC DISTURBANCE ON 08-11 OCT IS AGAIN VISIBLE ON THE SUN. ITS AREA, LOCATION, AND INTENSITY ARE ROUGHLY THE SAME AS LAST ROTATION.

sections.text: AT A LOW LEVEL. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 7613 AND TO A LESSER DEGREE REGION 7608.

sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE LARGEST EVENT WAS A LONG DURATION, FILAMENT RELATED C5/2F AT 31/1148Z FROM SPOTLESS PLAGE REGION 7612 (S16E23). THE FILAMENT DID NOT ERUPT AND NO RADIO EMISSIONS WERE OBSERVED. REGION 7613 (S12E59) NEARLY DOUBLED IN AREA, IN PART DUE TO INCREASED VISIBILITY AND ALSO REAL GROWTH. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 7618 (N08W05) CAME TO A BIT OF LIFE THIS PERIOD PRODUCING NUMEROUS C-CLASS FLARES.  IN WHITE LIGHT, THE REGION SHOWED RESTRUCTURING AND CONTINUES TO GROW IN SPOT NUMBER, AREA COVERAGE, AND COMPLEXITY. ALL REPORTS INDICATE THE REGION HAS DEVELOPED A DELTA IN THE NORTH CENTRAL PORTION OF THE GROUP WITH KINKED A N-S ORIENTED INVERSION LINE.  NEW REGION 7620 (N05E71) WAS NUMBERED LAST NIGHT.  THIS REGION IS PROBABLY THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7608.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 7618 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE C-CLASS, AND POSSIBLY M-CLASS ACTIVITY FOR THE REMAINDER OF ITS TIME ON THE DISK.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED FROM THE BEG- INNING OF THE PERIOD UNTIL 1211Z WHEN A DISTURBANCE BEGAN. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AT 1211Z (16 NANOTESLA IN BOULDER) AND WAS FOLLOWED BY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS AT MID-LATITUDES AND MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LAT- ITUDES. MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS WERE SEEN AT BOTH GEOSYNCH- RONOUS SATELLITES FROM ABOUT 1600-1730Z. THIS INCREASE WAS PROBABLY CAUSED BY A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH BRIEF STORM PERIODS FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS.  THE FIELD WILL QUIET DOWN TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 7618 (N07W31) REMAINS THE MOST IMPRESSIVE AREA ON THE DISK.  IN WHITE LIGHT, THE REGION HAS DECREASED IN AREA AND SPOT NUMBER, BUT STILL RETAINS ITS BETA-DELTA CONFIGURATION.  NEW REGION 7621 (S09E48) WAS NUMBERED OVERNIGHT.  AN AREA OF INTEREST TO WATCH IS ON THE EAST LIMB AT N12 WHERE AN IMPRESSIVE BRIGHT SURGE WAS REPORTED BY LEARMONTH LAST NIGHT.  ALL OTHER AREAS/REGIONS WERE STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE WITH REGION 7618 THE MOST LIKELY CANDIDATE TO PRODUCE C AND M-CLASS ACTIVITY.  A NEW, ACTIVE REGION MAY ROTATE INTO VIEW OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AND COULD ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS. SINCE 09Z, THE MIDDLE LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE FIRST TWO DAYS OF THE PERIOD WITH ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS EXPECTED EARLY ON DAY THREE DUE TO A FAVORABLY LOCATED CORONAL HOLE. sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7618 (N08W44) CONTINUED A SLOW DECLINE AND THE DELTA MAY FADE BY TOMORROW. REGION 7620 (N05E31) EMERGED AT A MODERATE PACE. NEW REGION 7622 (N13E72) SHOWED A SMALL H-CLASS SPOT IN A BROAD PLAGE FIELD. IN X-RAYS, THIS REGION IS MODERATELY LARGE AND BRIGHT. sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW WITH MANY C-CLASS FLARES OBSERVED. THE LARGEST WAS A C5 AT 25/0621Z THAT WAS OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7629 (S22E16) HAS GROWN SUBSTANTIALLY DURING THE PERIOD. REPORTS OF A DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE INTERMEDIATE SPOTS SHOW A CORRESPONDENCE BETWEEN THAT SITE AND THE LOCATION OF TWO SIZEABLE C-CLASS FLARES WHICH OCCURRED RECENTLY. THE EVENTS WERE A C9/1N AT 1721Z AND A C7/0F AT 2049Z. THE OTHER TW0 SPOTTED REGIONS WERE QUIET.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET UNTIL APPROXIMATELY 0500Z WHEN A CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE BEGAN. MID-LATITUDES WERE PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE AFTER THAT TIME. PLANETARY INDICES WERE ALSO IN THE ACTIVE CATEGORY BUT SOME HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS EXPERIENCED MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS IN THE LATTER HALF OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED ON 17 DEC WITH ACTIVE CONDITIONS PROBABLE DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME. MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE FORECAST FOR 18 DEC. ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO RETURN ON 20 DEC AS A RESULT OF THE FILAMENT DISRUPTION NOTED YESTERDAY. THE TIMING AND SEVERITY OF FILAMENT RELATED DISTURBANCES ARE DIFFICULT TO FORECAST.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY BECAME LOW DUE TO A LONG DURATION C2/SN FLARE AT 17/2029Z FROM REGION 7635 (N02E39). AT PRESS TIME, A REPORT WAS RECEIVED FROM THE CULGOORA OBSERVATORY THAT A TYPE IV MAY ACCOMPANY THIS FLARE. NO SUNSPOT DYNAMICS WERE OBSERVED IN THIS REGION AND THE MIXED POLARITIES OBSERVED YESTERDAY WEAKENED.  REGION 7637 (N07W18) CEASED THE GROWTH NOTED ON 16 DEC AND STABILIZED.

sections.text: TO A VERY LOW LEVEL. THE LONG DURATION C2 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE IS CHARACTERISTIC OF A DECAYING REGION AND ADDITIONAL OR LARGER EVENTS ARE NOT LIKELY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. NEW REGION 7640 (N09E70) PRODUCED SEVERAL SMALL C-CLASS FLARES AND NUMEROUS LESSER FLUCTUATIONS. THIS REGION IS NEW FROM LAST ROTATION AND APPEARS TO BE IN A GROWTH PHASE. THE SPOTS HERE ARE NOT IN A STANDARD BIPOLAR CONFIGURATION. REGION 7641 (N03E75) ALSO APPEARED BUT WAS QUIET. THIS IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7624 WHICH SEEMS TO HAVE SLOWLY DECAYED DURING ITS INVISIBLE HEMISPHERE TRANSIT. OTHER REGIONS WERE STABLE AND QUIET. RECENT YOHKOH IMAGES DO NOT SHOW THE LARGE CORONAL HOLE IN THE NORTHEAST QUADRANT THAT HAS BEEN PERSISTENT FOR MANY ROTATIONS. IT MAY BECOME VISIBLE AS THOSE LONGITUDES APPROACH CENTRAL MERIDIAN.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A GENERALLY LOW LEVEL. REGION 7640 IS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES. ONCE THE MAGNETIC STRUCTURE CAN BE OBSERVED, THIS FORECAST MAY INCREASE. AT THIS TIME, REGION 7640 DOES NOT APPEAR CAPABLE OF GENERATING A MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 7640 (N08E21) PRODUCED TWO M1/1N FLARES MAXING AT 1507Z AND 1815Z.  NO RADIO ACTIVITY WAS REPORTED WITH THESE TWO FLARES.  NUMEROUS C-CLASS FLARING HAS ALSO OCCURRED IN THIS REGION OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. WHITE LIGHT OBSERVATIONS INDICATE 7640 HAS NEARLY DOUBLED IN SPOT NUMBER AND HAS GROWN SIGNIFICANTLY IN AREA WITH RAPID PENUMBRA DEVELOPMENT THROUGHOUT THE REGION.  TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED OVERNIGHT -- RGN 7642 (N10W20) AND RGN 7643 (S16E69).  ALL OTHER REGIONS WERE STABLE.  ONE OTHER ITEM OF NOTE TO PASS ON:  JUST MINUTES AGO, SANTA CLAUS WAS POSITIVELY IDENTIFIED ON RADAR LEAVING THE POLAR CAP AND PASSING THROUGH THE AURORAL OVAL.  ANY MINOR DISTURBANCES IN IONOSPHERIC SIGNA- TURES SHOULD BE ATTRIBUTED TO THIS SEASONAL PHENOMENON.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 7640, 7645 AND 7646 ALL HAVE A GOOD POTENTIAL FOR C-CLASS FLARING. REGIONS 7640 AND 7645 HAVE THE BEST CHANCE OF OCCASIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO ACTIVE OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS THEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED. A WELL POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE HAS SO FAR FAILED TO PRODUCE AN ANTICIPATED MAGNETIC DISTURBANCE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. INTERMITTENT C-CLASS ACTIVITY WAS THE ORDER OF THE DAY, WITH THE BRUNT OF THE FLARES ORIGINATING IN OR NEAR THE REGION 7640 (N08W80) COMPLEX. REPORTS CHARACTERIZE THIS AREA AS BEING LARGELY STABLE. REGION 7645 (N11E43) IN THE OPPOSITE HEMISPHERE HAD ONLY A FEW SMALL FLARES, BUT REMAINS COMPLEX MAGNETICALLY. ONE NEW REGION WAS BORN ON THE DISK, 7647 (S15E34).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 7640 AND 7645 HOLD THE BEST PROMISE OF AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET EARLY IN THE PERIOD, THEN EXPERIENCED MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS AT THE MIDWAY POINT. THIS DISTURBANCE, THOUGHT TO BE RELATED TO A WESTERN HEMISPHERE CORONAL HOLE, NOW SEEMS TO BE WEAKENING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED, WITH EPISODES OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS LIKELY DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES.
